definition[0]: to get better again after an illness or injury
example[0]: Coles is recuperating from a sprained ankle.
definition[1]: to get back money that you have spent or lost in business
definition[2]: to return to a more normal condition after a difficult time
example[2]: Winston proposed several ways for the industry to recuperate.
definition[3]: to increase or improve after falling in value or getting worse
example[3]: International bond markets continued to recuperate after Monday’s severe losses.
definition[4]: to get back money that you have lost or spent
example[4]: He hopes to recuperate at least part of the $3 million.
